home.mainInfo:
Hello. I'm Sohee Yun,
 a front-end developer who prioritizes user experience above all else,
balancing convenience with aesthetic sensibility.

info.title: Hello. I'm Sohee Yun, a web front-end developer.
info.description:
While studying UI/UX design with great interest,
I developed a passion to not just design but also implement things myself,
so I learned front-end development through a combination of self-study and academy courses.
That's how I took my first steps as a developer, and since then,
I've gained practical experience in various environments.

home.careerSubTitle: I've been working on the front end

selfIntroduction.title: Self-Introduction
selfIntroduction.content:
Prioritizing user experience above all else,
I am Yoon Sohee, a front-end developer who values both convenience and aesthetic appeal.

conversion.title: Reasons for shifting from design to development
conversion.content:
The reason I became a developer was because there was an answer.
I learned design starting in middle school.
What I felt while doing design was that [it was highly subjective].
Development was great because it had the first answer: [the functionality works properly]. I enjoyed the process of refining the quality of my answers through refactoring, which is why I kept doing it.

circumstances.title: How I Started Programming
circumstances.content:
What I realized while designing is that it's highly subjective.
I took a markup-related class in college, and I was fascinated by how actions triggered and pages transitioned.
Later, when I attended a markup and jQuery academy, I found it easier and more enjoyable than I had imagined.
Thinking that this level of skill was enough to venture into bigger waters, I transitioned to front-end development. I felt joy when I explored new things, learned, pondered, and finally produced an output.

studyMethod.title: My Personal Development Learning Method
studyMethod.content:
I enjoy creating toy projects using my limited skills.
When I tried to develop the habit of using only JavaScript after relying solely on jQuery, I made a ladder-climbing project. When I started studying Vue, I created a household ledger and a Trello admin project.
I read books and follow examples, but there's a lot I don't understand.
Even so, I follow along, but it wasn't fun.
However, when I create a project by applying what I've learned, I grasp concepts, think, ponder, and search repeatedly. I keep writing down various solutions in my notebook, try them out, and repeat the process.

value.title: The most valuable experience in my work history
value.content:
Every time I learn something new and release it for commercial use, I feel it holds value.
During the height of jQuery's popularity, I launched a service using Vue and Nuxt.
It was the project with the highest engagement I'd worked on to date, and since it was my first time using Vue, I was eager to develop it as cleanly as possible. I consulted extensively with other developers and tested diligently.
The new structure and different usage patterns presented challenges, but despite the larger scale compared to previous projects, fewer issues arose.

difficult.title: Methods to overcome difficulties
difficult.content:
We worked on a project called Jipdak Partial Construction.
This was an interior brokerage platform that had to be completed within a little over two months, including QA.
Since we had only used Vue.js before, we had many concerns about server-side rendering.
Vue.js (vue-cli) is fundamentally built as a SPA (Single Page Application) project, which is disadvantageous for search engine optimization.
While there were several solutions available within Vue.js itself, I decided to develop using Nuxt.js. This choice was recommended in the official Vue.js guide and had also been mentioned during my frontend studies.
Surprisingly, the development approach with Vue.js wasn't significantly different, and it actually provided an environment where I could focus on development.
As a result, server-side rendering was properly implemented, and we completed the project within a short deadline with minimal issues.
The reason I shared this case study is that it demonstrated how challenging a better approach, rather than stubbornly sticking to what I already knew, led to a superior outcome.
